metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7225 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer through 0.9.11. rfbProcessClientNormalMessage() in rfbserver.c does not sanitize msg.cct.length, leading to access to uninitialized and potentially sensitive data or possibly unspecified other impact (e.g., an integer overflow) via specially crafted VNC packets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

italc-client - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.2
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

vino - 3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: italc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1').
libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.2').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
vino package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3').
